author: Simon Rice
title: Arjen Robben had a tantrum and his Bayern Munich team-mates found it hysterical
text:
Arjen Robben was furious at being subbed off for Renato Sanchez in the 85th minute (Getty) Arjen Robben had a tantrum at being substituted last night and his Bayern Munich team-mates had the best response – by laughing hysterically at his behaviour.
The Netherlands captain was furious at being taken off during his side’s game away at Borussia Monchengladbach with his team 1-0 up.
David Luiz provides major update on three-month knee injury The 33-year-old stomped to the bench before sitting down and drinking a bottle of water as angrily as it is possible to do.
His team-mates found the whole thing hilarious, with Xabi Alonso and Franck Ribery in particular in stitches at Robben’s behaviour.
. @ArjenRobben doesn't take too kindly to be substituted…and his @FCBayernEN teammates find it hilarious. https://t.co/PTygcqj9E7 
— BT Sport Football (@btsportfootball) March 19, 2017 

Bayern held onto their lead to win the match and move 13 points clear at the top of the Bundesliga.
After the match, manager Carlo Ancellotti was asked about Robben’s behaviour and the Italian said he had no issue with it.
‘I was never happy when I got substituted either when I still played,’ he said. ‘I do not have any problem with his reaction.’
